If this is a common thing then -1000 faith in humanity.

topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557b61e663687217f6001049#post_557b61e663687217f6001049
The reason why lying to bed someone isn't illegal is that it would cause a hell of a legal nightmare.


Could you imagine if someone did:
"You told me you were a millionaire!  *person jailed*"
"You told me you weren't wearing makeup!  *person jailed*"
"You told me you owned a ferrari!  *person jailed*"
"You told me you were president of the usa!  *person jailed*"


If such laws were created then it would probably collapse the legal system.  The only reason why I would see a country actually going through with such a law would be to make the general populace afraid to have sex as a means of literal morality policing.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557b63b363687228b4000d5d#post_557b63b363687228b4000d5d
The sex offender registry is on the border of collapsing under it's own weight at this point.  They don't have enough funding and they constantly 24/7/365 have to constantly constantly constantly constantly constantly constantly add new people on it.

To use a metaphor imagine sticking 100 students into a average sized classroom then slashing the budget by 90%.

Also putting someone on the registry permanently fucks a person's life forever; kind of a shitty thing to do cause the person they had sex with didn't have enough brains to realize they weren't actually the president of the galaxy.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557b644d63687206f7001a81#post_557b644d63687206f7001a81
Hence the five years thing, enough to put the hurt on but leave plenty of time to fix things, we can give them all the spots being given to morons who piss behind a car in public,
topics.author: 509f70a87f123b77eb0004fd

topics.body: Post for the sake of posting!

"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557b650b63687223050010ca#post_557b650b63687223050010ca
It would still collapse the legal system.

No offense, but that is why morality laws are logistically bad ideas.

You could theoretically pump all that money into the registry *BUT* you would have to take a metric fuck ton of money away from law enforcement.  Sure you would make people scared to lie during sex but then you wouldn't have any police in the street.

topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557b675963687260be000b65#post_557b675963687260be000b65
The thing is though we're talking about college frats.  College frats from personal experience are super majority wise *REALLY REALLY* dumb.  I'm more shocked that there are people that are fooled by these sorts than anything.

Last time I had to have a college frat as a roommate he was so dumb and his friends were so dumb that they had a beer party right next door to the resident assistant and when they got caught one of them had a car chase over a $15 ticket. . That's not a joke either; I'm actually legitimately surprised some people are so dumb as to give the police a car chase over a $15 ticket.
